column3: written in Ruby on Rails ; the application lets users upload scanned maps and georeference them against OpenStreetMap .þDeveloped by Tim Waters
column4: Map Warper is an open-source georeferencing service
column5: written in Ruby on Rails ; the application lets users upload scanned maps and georeference them against OpenStreetMap . It allows the georeferencing and visualization of geographic areas without the need to install software .

column1: It allows the georeferencing and visualization of geographic areas without the need to install software .þThe tool is implemented in various digital projects across the world and used by many professionals who are not necessarily experts in the field of cartography .

column1: þYou can also change latitude and longitude points manually .
þNote : You will see there is an Error value for each control point .
þMap Warper uses a Root Mean Square ( RMS ) error calculation to evaluate the transformation of the different control points .
þThe RMS error provides a rough guide to how consistent your control points are to one another with reference to the map ’ s transformation
column2: and it assesses how distorted your map will be .

column1: You can also add the following georeferenced basemaps from Map Warper :þHigh RMS error values indicate that your control points are less consistent with one another
column2: while a low RMS error value indicates more consistency and reduced distortion . It is generally recommended that you keep your error values low and replace or remove control points with high values .

column1: þWhile the RMS error provides a good way to assess the transformation ’ s accuracy
column2: you should always re-evaluate how well your scanned map matches up to the GIS modern map .
